title: "Data Types"
---

# DATA TYPES

#1. numeric - (10, 45, 5, 78, 45.2)
#2. integer - (1L, 50L, 45L, where the letter "L" declares this as an integer)
#3. complex - (9 + 3i, where "i" is the imaginary part)
#4. character (a.k.a. string) - ("k", "R is exciting", "FALSE", "11.5")
#5. logical (a.k.a. boolean) - (TRUE or FALSE)

```{r}
a <- 32.3
print(a) # 32.3

b <- 100L
paste(b, b+1, b+a) # 100 101
```

```{r}
# numeric
x <- 10.5
class(x)

# integer
x <- 1000L
class(x)

# complex
x <- 9i + 3
class(x)

# character/string
x <- "R is exciting"
class(x)

# logical/boolean
x <- TRUE
class(x)
```

## Type Conversion
```{r}
c <- as.integer(a)
d <- as.numeric(b)

class(c)
class(d)
```
